main.name: Alex Montague
main.description: I am in my third year of schooling, and I am always looking for
main.description2: Whether that be open source projects, internships, or new technologies,
main.bio: I am a software engineer. This doesn't just mean I like to program, but rather I am passionate about writing clean, smart, and efficient code! Over my schooling and work terms I have been exposed to many languages and frameworks, but some of my favourite languages are Javascript, C and Java. I have recently begun my dive into web development, more specifically using the ReactJS/NodeJS libraries. I hope to explore more full stack opportunities in the future!

resume.skillmessage: Just some technology I am passionate about, and an overview of my skills

education.description: Currently in my third year studying Software Engineering. Some of the most intesting/favourite courses I have taken so far have been Software Design I - IV, Data Structures, Algorithms, Operating Systems and the infamous 'Angel of Death' (Software Systems and Integrations). Currently on the Dean's List for maintaining an overall average of 80%. Currently looking forward to my databases and software design V class.

Highschool is where I was first introduced to programming and computer science. Started learning the fundamentals using the Turing and Java programming languages. Graduated as an Ontario Scholar and maintained an overall average of 95% in all CIS courses.

work.title: Student Web Developer
work.description: Coinsquare is a 21st century financial institution specializing in trading and managing cryptocurrencies. Coinsquare was rated the 2nd most sought after startup in Canada by LinkedIn! I joined the team as a student web developer and have been working on our web application for both the front end and backend teams. As one of Coinsquare's first interns, I had the pleasure of participating and presenting in the first ever Coinsquare hackathon, as well as being able to be a full functioning and independant developer! This was an absolutely amazing placement and I have learned so much not just about web development, but also about blockchain technology, project management, leadership and communication in an agile team! Checkout an article I wrote about my experiences HERE!

work.title: Senior Greenskeeper
work.description: Managed and led a team of junior employees on daily projects around the golf club such as coordinating the mowing of a specific area, or systematically cleaning up after weather. I also Interacted with different team members every day, to maintain and keep course conditions pristine while having a golf member centered mentality.

row1.text: I have been doing a lot of frontend work with the react library, and I absolutely love it! It is so versatile and is my go to for frontend web development. Pairing React with some other very powerful libraries and frameworks that I like (redux, axios, styled components) makes for a super strong frontend stack!

After recently branching out into backend web development, node, express and knex are some of the tools I am using to build my backend architecture. I am still learning lots about backend development!

After learning SQL at school through projects, I was able use these skills at my current co-op where we utilized MySQL and PostgreSQL. I still have much to learn (and my upcoming databased course will help) in terms of relational databases, but I am also open and exploring non-relational databases such as MongoDB for personal use.

row2.text: The C Programming language is the main language taught at UofG, and probably my most strong language. I liked the low-levelness of this language, and my algorithms and data structures classes all utilized C. Learning this language made me appreciate dynamic languages, but also allowed me to understand how they work behind the scenes.
Java is my favourite OO language and I have been programming with Java since highschool. I made my first graphical application with Java while working at my previous job, check it out below!
Python is something I am still exploring/learning, but I am very interested in it as I would like to explore AI/Machine learning in the future. Not to mention no more curly braces and semicolons :)

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
